gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Ecoregions of the United States and the World USDA/FS/IMI

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: Description of the Ecoregions of the United States

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: "Description of the Ecoregions of the United States" is a volume thatwas originally published in 1978 to provide a general description ofthe ecosystem geography of the Nation as shown on the 1976 map"Ecoregions of the United States." It was first published as anunnumbered publication by the Intermountain Region, USDA ForestService, Ogden, Utah. It was reprinted in 1980 by the Forest Service,Washington, DC, as Miscellaneous Publication No. 1391. An explanationof the basis for the regions delineated on the map was presentedelsewhere (Bailey 1983).The technique of mapping ecoregions was subsequently expanded toinclude the rest of North America (Bailey and Cushwa 1981) and theworld (Bailey 1989). In 1993, as part of the Forest Service's NationalHierarchical Framework of Ecological Units (ECOMAP 1993), ecoregionswere adopted for use in ecosystem management.The USDA Forest Service recently published a revised version of theecoregions map of North America by Robert G. Bailey in cooperationwith The Nature Conservancy and the U.S. Geological Survey. This 29" x32" full-color map shows, at a scale of 1:15,000,000, the division ofthe continent into a hierarchy of ecosystem regions. The map replacesthe now outdated map of North America ecoregions which was issued in1981 by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service. The revised map can beused to address environmental issues that transcend agency, watershed,and political boundaries and borders.The Ecoregions of the World is also available. The world map is alsoavailable on CD from NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center as partof their Global Ecosystem Database Project.?? The NOAA/NGDC version ofthe map was reprojected from the original projection to a geographic(lat/long) projection. ??All maps are available for download as ARC/INFO export files for PC orUnix machines:"http://www.fs.fed.us/institute/ecoregions/eco_download.html" [ This document was provided by NASA's Global Change Master Directory. For more information on the source of this metadata please visit http://gcmd.nasa.gov/r/geoss/[GCMD]USDA_ECOREGIONS ]

gmd19157:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Calculation of omission and commission statistics from sample polygons.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation of the global land cover map

gmd19157:valueType.gco:RecordType: Confusion matrix recording counts from ground truthing

gmd19157:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: 1. Analysis published in a peer-reviewed journal article with full description of methodology.

gmd19157:statement.gco:CharacterString: The thematic validation procedure was carried out using design-based inference which conforms to the CEOS Cal-Val recommendations. The resulting research was published in a peer-reviewed journal, and the component datasets generated for the validation are available online.
The thematic validation procedure was carried out using design-based inference which conforms to the CEOS Cal-Val recommendations.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Stratified sampling of ground truth blocks.

gmd19157:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Systematic sampling to obtain an irregular stratification with different sampling rates for each stratum.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Joint Research Centre of the European Commission

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Schematic sub-sampling of all landcover categories

Interpretation by regional experts of 3x3km sample boxes at specified sample sites. Regional interpreters used ancillary data like aerial photographs, thematic maps and NDVI profiles at coarse resolution in support to the Landsat interpretation.

gmd19157:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Local knowledge required to verify exact landcovers at each ground truth point.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Collected table of landcover categories for all sample sites.
Cross-validation of independently interpreted sites against data to generate confusion matrix and Kappa statistic.

gmd19157:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Identification of classes prone to confusion, and overall assessment of the accuracy of the classification.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Confusion matrix and overall accuracy value.

gvq:knownProblem.gco:CharacterString: Legend issues with South East Asia

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata record is publicly available.
